channel.title: Modeling and NPC INT HELP
channel.description:
Well for #1 i have over 20k models in .dat format idk what to do and then the NPC INTS [code] if(i == ###) { // NPC ID aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_60.anInt1406 = anIntArray72[630]; class5.method165(true, aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_60); // Don't need to worry class5.aStringArray66 = new String[5]; class5.aStringArray66[1] = "Attack"; // This string could be changed to anything, for example, in hunting, catch. class5.anIntArray94 = new int[1]; // Number of models the NPC uses, the [1] part class5.anIntArray94[0] = #####; // MODEL ID class5.aString65 = "@@@@@"; // NPC name class5.anInt61 = ######; // Combat level } [/code]
[code] if(i == ###) { // NPC ID aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_60.anInt1406 = anIntArray72[630]; class5.method165(true, aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_60); // Don't need to worry class5.aStringArray66 = new String[5]; class5.aStringArray66[1] = "Attack"; // This string could be changed to anything, for example, in hunting, catch. class5.anIntArray94 = new int[4]; // Number of models the NPC uses, notice the [4] part class5.anIntArray94[0] = #####; // MODEL ID 1 class5.anIntArray94[1] = #####; // MODEL ID 2 class5.anIntArray94[2] = #####; // MODEL ID 3 class5.anIntArray94[3] = #####; // MODEL ID 4 class5.aString65 = "@@@@@"; // NPC name class5.anInt61 = ######; // Combat level } [/code]
Can someone Explain this better to me?

item.title: Modeling and NPC INT HELP
item.dc:creator: @Mod_Brandon12111 Mod Brandon12111
item.description:
@Mod_Brandon12111 wrote:

I still dont get what you mean.

Read full topic

item.title: Modeling and NPC INT HELP
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Mod Brandon12111:

ok but what does it mean by model id’s the items i want it to drop or what…?

No, they are the ID’s that make up the NPC, if it is in more than one .dat or .gz file for the full npc, you will need more than 1 model ID to load. Without ALL of the corresponding models being loaded, you will have missing peices in the npc.

Read full topic

item.title: Modeling and NPC INT HELP
item.dc:creator: @Mod_Brandon12111 Mod Brandon12111

item.title: Modeling and NPC INT HELP
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

how can this be better explained? What? To make an Example? (ill do one, but it wont be correct)

if(i == 102) { // NPC ID
    aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_60.anInt1406 = anIntArray72[630]; 
    class5.method165(true, aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_60); // Don't need to worry
    class5.aStringArray66 = new String[5];
    class5.aStringArray66[1] = "Talk To"; // This string could be changed to anything, for example, in hunting, catch.
         class5.anIntArray94 = new int[4]; // Number of models the NPC uses, notice the [4] part
         class5.anIntArray94[0] = 1002; // MODEL ID 1
         class5.anIntArray94[1] = 1003; // MODEL ID 2
         class5.anIntArray94[2] = 1004; // MODEL ID 3
         class5.anIntArray94[3] = 1005; // MODEL ID 4
    class5.aString65 = "Example NPC"; // NPC name
    class5.anInt61 = 156; // Combat level
}

Read full topic

item.title: Modeling and NPC INT HELP
item.dc:creator: @Mod_Brandon12111 Mod Brandon12111
item.description:
@Mod_Brandon12111 wrote:

Well for #1 i have over 20k models in .dat format idk what to do and then the NPC INTS

if(i == ###) { // NPC ID
    aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_60.anInt1406 = anIntArray72[630]; 
    class5.method165(true, aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_60); // Don't need to worry
    class5.aStringArray66 = new String[5];
    class5.aStringArray66[1] = "Attack"; // This string could be changed to anything, for example, in hunting, catch.
         class5.anIntArray94 = new int[1]; // Number of models the NPC uses, the [1] part
         class5.anIntArray94[0] = #####; // MODEL ID
    class5.aString65 = "@@@@@"; // NPC name
    class5.anInt61 = ######; // Combat level
}
if(i == ###) { // NPC ID
    aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_60.anInt1406 = anIntArray72[630]; 
    class5.method165(true, aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_60); // Don't need to worry
    class5.aStringArray66 = new String[5];
    class5.aStringArray66[1] = "Attack"; // This string could be changed to anything, for example, in hunting, catch.
         class5.anIntArray94 = new int[4]; // Number of models the NPC uses, notice the [4] part
         class5.anIntArray94[0] = #####; // MODEL ID 1
         class5.anIntArray94[1] = #####; // MODEL ID 2
         class5.anIntArray94[2] = #####; // MODEL ID 3
         class5.anIntArray94[3] = #####; // MODEL ID 4
    class5.aString65 = "@@@@@"; // NPC name
    class5.anInt61 = ######; // Combat level
}

Can someone Explain this better to me?

Read full topic
